description: Valid examples of functions performing mathematical operations

input.natural_language: Create function to add two numbers

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="add" return-type="number">
  <q:param name="a" type="number" required="true" />
  <q:param name="b" type="number" required="true" />
  <q:return value="{a} + {b}" />
</q:function>

<q:call function="add" a="5" b="3" />

input.natural_language: Multiply two numbers with type validation

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="multiply" return-type="number" validate-params="true">
  <q:param name="x" type="number" required="true" />
  <q:param name="y" type="number" required="true" />
  <q:return value="{x} * {y}" />
</q:function>

<q:call function="multiply" x="4" y="7" />

input.natural_language: Function to calculate area given width and height

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:function name="calculateArea" return-type="number">
  <q:param name="width" type="number" required="true" min="0" />
  <q:param name="height" type="number" required="true" min="0" />
  <q:return value="{width} * {height}" />
</q:function>

<q:call function="calculateArea" width="5" height="10" />
